intro: Tragacantha porrecta, commonly known as the straighttragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces a milky sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to green, and it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Tragacantha porrecta is known for its adaptability to arid environments and is often found in scrubland and woodland areas.
